intro: Sida zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sida zahlbruckneri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
